title: Greek-Style Potatoes Recipe
description: These delicious Greek potatoes are baked with olive oil, garlic, and herbs in a savory lemon broth until soft and creamy inside with crispy edges.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Side Dish Potato Greek-Style Potatoes 4.6 (608) 456 Reviews 30 Photos These Greek potatoes are moist, lemony, and simple to make for a delicious potato side dish. This recipe is the closest I can get to the real thing. It's best to adjust the flavorings to your taste as you bake it — I sometimes add a little more lemon juice. Submitted by Cathie Updated on March 27, 2025 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 30 30 30 30 Prep Time: 20 mins Cook Time: 1 hr 30 mins Total Time: 1 hr 50 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 6 potatoes, peeled and quartered 1 ½ cups water ⅓ cup olive oil ¼ cup fresh lemon juice 2 cloves garlic, finely chopped 2 cubes chicken bouillon 1 teaspoon dried thyme 1 teaspoon dried rosemary ground black pepper to taste Directions Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Arrange potatoes evenly in the bottom of a medium baking dish. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Mix water, olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, bouillon cubes, thyme, rosemary, and pepper together in a small bowl. Pour mixture over potatoes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Cover and bake in the preheated oven, turning occasionally, until potatoes are tender yet firm, 1 ½ to 2 hours. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 862 home cooks made it! If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Greek-Style Potatoes 01 of 30 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 30 Photo by  Mark Daye 01/06/2023 My potatoes got very mushy and I am not sure why? I used baking potatoes. That said, I really liked the flavour of them. I used bottled lemon juice and beef broth because that is what I had and they taste great, but too mushy. I think my oven was too hot at 350F. I wil try again at a lower temperature. The photo shows them after about 30 minutes in the oven. 03 of 30 Photo by  Trusted Brands 05/19/2020 04 of 30 Photo by  CHOCTHUNDER1 02/23/2020 05 of 30 Photo by  Liv 08/22/2019 06 of 30 Photo by  Lydia 04/25/2019 07 of 30 Photo by  Shelly DC 08/24/2018 No changes. Came out amazing!!! Thanks 08 of 30 Photo by  JoAnn Quinlan 04/01/2017 Easy to make. My son loved them. Didn't change a thing. 09 of 30 Photo by  rache 03/17/2017 10 of 30 Photo by  Dan Radinovic 01/10/2017 1 2 3 Next You’ll Also Love Greek Garlic-Lemon Potatoes Recipe 108 Ratings Greek Lemon Potatoes 14 Ratings Roasted Greek Lemon Potatoes 313 Ratings Greek-Style Lemon Potatoes 7 Ratings Garlic, Lemon, and Herb Greek-Style Potatoes 30 Ratings Feta Roasted Potatoes 4 Ratings Lemon Horseradish New Potatoes 429 Ratings Grilled Greek Potatoes 2 Ratings Roasted Garlic Scalloped Potatoes 89 Ratings Gigantes (Greek Lima Beans) 85 Ratings Greek Lemon Chicken and Potato Bake 884 Ratings Easy Fasolakia 2 Ratings Irish Champ 177 Ratings Greek Lemon-Garlic Chicken Thighs and Potatoes 16 Ratings Dad's Kentucky Home Fries 52 Ratings Greek-Style Garlic Chicken Breasts 333 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Cathie
